glsa.title: Squid: Denial of Service through DNS responses
glsa.synopsis: Squid contains a bug in the handling of certain DNS responses resulting in a Denial of Service.

background.p: Squid is a full-featured Web proxy cache designed to run on Unix-like systems. It supports proxying and caching of HTTP, FTP, and other protocols, as well as SSL support, cache hierarchies, transparent caching, access control lists and many other features.

description.p: Handling of certain DNS responses trigger assertion failures.

impact.p: By returning a specially crafted DNS response an attacker could cause Squid to crash by triggering an assertion failure.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
